## ggplot2

<hr/>

This session focuses on the popular `ggplot2` package for creating visualizations in the R language.

::: incremental
-   ggplot2 basics
    -   geom & aesthetics
    -   scales, labels, theme
    -   facets
-   extensions
-   adding interactivity
:::

## Why ggplot2?

<hr/>

-   Easier to learn
-   Composible
-   Extensible
-   Good documentation: <https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/>

## Grammar of graphics

<hr/>

> A theory about the structure of data visualizations.

Graphics are defined in terms of their:

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   data
-   statistics
-   aesthetic mapping
-   geometries
-   facets
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
-   scales
-   coordinates
-   labels
-   theme
:::
:::
